title: Pricing Table - Usage Examples
description: Common usage patterns and example configurations for pricing tables

examples.name: Simple Basic Plan
examples.description: Minimal pricing table with essential information
examples.visualDescription: Clean pricing card: 'Basic Plan' title, '$19/month' price, centered alignment, simple feature list with checkmarks
examples.useCase: Starter plans, simple pricing pages, minimal designs
notes: style='style-1' is default clean design
stylishList creates icon-based feature list
Each feature needs showIcon:true to display icon
ctaText becomes clickable button (styled by parent)

examples.name: Premium Plan with Discount
examples.description: Pricing table showing original price crossed out and discounted price
examples.visualDescription: Purple pricing card: 'Premium' title, strikethrough '$79/month', prominent '$49/month' in purple, savings badge
examples.useCase: Sales, promotions, limited-time offers, annual billing discounts

examples.name: Enterprise Plan with Custom Icon
examples.description: High-tier pricing table with custom icon and extensive features
examples.visualDescription: Dark pricing card: Purple building icon at top, 'Enterprise' title, 'Contact Us' price, comprehensive feature list, 'Contact Sales' button

iconWidth controls icon container size (square)

examples.name: Recommended Plan with Ribbon
examples.description: Popular pricing plan with 'Recommended' ribbon badge
examples.visualDescription: Highlighted pricing card with purple 'Recommended' ribbon in top-right corner, slightly elevated, '$39/month' prominent display

notes: disRibbon=true enables ribbon badge
ribbonStyle controls ribbon appearance (style-1, style-2, style-3)
ribbonText customizable ('Recommended', 'Popular', 'Best Value', etc.)
Ribbon draws attention to preferred plan
Typically styled differently in parent container (border, shadow, scale)

examples.name: Annual Pricing with Large Discount
examples.description: Annual billing option showing significant savings
examples.visualDescription: Pricing card: '$99/year' large, strikethrough '$228/year' above, '57% off' badge, 'Save $129' highlighted
examples.useCase: Annual subscriptions, yearly billing, maximize revenue through longer commitments
notes: Emphasize savings in subTitle and ribbon
Show monthly equivalent math (12 √ó $19 = $228, save $129)
Gift icon emphasizes 'free months' value
Annual pricing increases customer lifetime value

examples.name: Feature-Rich Plan with Read More
examples.description: Extensive feature list with expandable read more functionality
examples.visualDescription: Pricing card showing first 3 features, '+ Show all options' link, expands to reveal 10+ features when clicked
examples.useCase: Plans with many features, avoiding overwhelming users, progressive disclosure
notes: readMoreToggle=true enables expand/collapse
showListToggle='3' shows first 3 features initially
readMoreText/readLessText customize toggle button labels
Great for plans with 6+ features
Keeps pricing table compact while showing all value

validationRules.title: Required - Plan name displayed to users
validationRules.subTitle: Optional - Plan description/tagline
validationRules.style: Optional - Overall table style (style-1, style-2, style-3)
validationRules.iconStore: Required if iconType='icon' - Font Awesome class
validationRules.imgStore: Required if iconType='img' - Image object with url
validationRules.priceValue: Required - Price amount or text ('99.99', 'Contact Us', 'Free')
validationRules.disPrePrice: Optional - Set true to show previous/discount price
validationRules.stylishList: Required if contentStyle='stylish' - Array of features
validationRules.showListToggle: Required if readMoreToggle=true - Number of visible features (string)
validationRules.disRibbon: Optional - Set true to enable ribbon badge
validationRules.ribbonText: Required if disRibbon=true - Ribbon label text

warnings: ‚ö†Ô∏è CONTENT STYLE: Must choose between 'wysiwyg' (HTML) or 'stylish' (icon list) - cannot use both
‚ö†Ô∏è FEATURE LIST: Each stylishList item needs showIcon:true to display icon
‚ö†Ô∏è DISCOUNT PRICE: disPrePrice requires prevPriceValue to be set
‚ö†Ô∏è READ MORE: showListToggle is a string ('3', '5'), not a number
‚ö†Ô∏è ICON TYPE: iconType='icon' requires iconStore (Font Awesome), iconType='img' requires imgStore
‚ö†Ô∏è RIBBON: disRibbon=true requires ribbonText to be set
‚ö†Ô∏è CTA STYLING: ctaText button styling controlled by parent/theme, not by pricing table
‚ö†Ô∏è TOOLTIPS: eIcnToggle enables extra info icon with tooltip (requires tooltipText)
‚ö†Ô∏è ICON COLORS: iconNmlColor/iconHvrColor in stylishList items control per-feature icon colors
‚ö†Ô∏è ALIGNMENT: All alignments (titleAlign, priceAlign, ctaAlign) are responsive objects
‚ö†Ô∏è WYSIWYG: HTML content may need sanitization - avoid unsafe tags/scripts
‚ö†Ô∏è PRICE TEXT: priceValue can be text ('Contact Us', 'Free') not just numbers
commonMistakes: ‚ùå Setting contentStyle='stylish' but not providing stylishList array
‚ùå Forgetting showIcon:true on stylishList items (icons won't appear)
‚ùå Using number for showListToggle (should be string: '3' not 3)
‚ùå Setting disPrePrice=true without prevPriceValue (no discount shown)
‚ùå Setting ribbonText without disRibbon=true (ribbon won't appear)
‚ùå Using iconType='icon' without iconStore (no icon shown)
‚ùå Mixing wysiwyg and stylish content styles in same plan
‚ùå Not setting eIcnToggle=true when adding tooltips (tooltip icon won't show)
‚ùå Using alignment values as strings ('center') instead of objects ({md: 'center'})
‚ùå Adding too many features without readMoreToggle (overwhelming users)
‚ùå Using generic CTA text like 'Buy' instead of specific 'Start Free Trial'
bestPractices: ‚úÖ Use descriptive plan names: 'Professional' not 'Plan 2', 'Starter' not 'Basic'
‚úÖ Keep subTitle concise: 'For growing teams' not 'This plan is designed for teams that are growing'
‚úÖ Show discounts prominently: Use disPrePrice=true and ribbonText='Save 25%'
‚úÖ Limit visible features to 3-5, use readMoreToggle for 6+ features
‚úÖ Use consistent icons: fa-check for standard features, custom icons for premium features
‚úÖ Make recommended plan stand out: Use ribbon, different styling, larger size
‚úÖ Use 'Contact Us' for enterprise pricing instead of specific numbers
‚úÖ Add tooltips (eIcnToggle) for complex features that need explanation
‚úÖ Keep CTA text action-oriented: 'Start Free Trial' not 'Click Here'
‚úÖ For annual plans, emphasize savings: 'Save $100/year' in subTitle or ribbon
‚úÖ Use iconType='icon' for professional appearance (crown, star, building icons)
‚úÖ Align title, price, CTA to center for balanced design
‚úÖ Test with long feature descriptions to ensure layout doesn't break
‚úÖ Use stylish list over wysiwyg for structured, scannable features
‚úÖ Limit to 3-4 pricing tiers to avoid overwhelming users
‚úÖ Place most popular/recommended plan in the middle for visibility

accessibilityNotes: üåê WCAG 2.1 AA Compliance:
- Plan titles must be clear and descriptive (title attribute)
- Price must be readable by screen readers (proper semantic markup)
- Feature list items should use list markup (automatic with stylishList)
- CTA buttons must have sufficient contrast (4.5:1 text, 3:1 button)
- Ribbon text must be readable (adequate contrast, minimum 14px font)
üéØ Focus States:
- CTA button must have visible focus indicator
- Read more toggle must be keyboard accessible
- Tooltip triggers must work with keyboard (Enter/Space)
‚å®Ô∏è Keyboard Navigation:
- Tab to CTA button, Enter/Space to activate
- Tab to read more toggle, Enter/Space to expand/collapse
- Tooltip icons accessible via Tab + Enter
üîä Screen Reader Considerations:
- Title announced: 'Professional plan'
- Price announced: '39 dollars per month'
- Previous price announced: 'Originally 79 dollars, now 39 dollars'
- Features announced as list items
- Ribbon announced: 'Recommended plan'
- Tooltips announced when activated
üåà Color Contrast:
- Title text: 4.5:1 contrast with background
- Price text: 4.5:1 contrast (usually larger, 3:1 acceptable)
- Feature text: 4.5:1 contrast
- Icons: 3:1 contrast if conveying information
- Ribbon: 4.5:1 contrast for text
- Previous price strikethrough must still be readable
üí° Best Practices:
- Don't rely on color alone to highlight recommended plan (use ribbon + text)
- Provide text alternative for icon-only features
- Ensure tooltips work on keyboard and touch devices
- Use semantic HTML in wysiwyg content (p, ul, li, strong)
